abstract: JPMorgan Chase is pushing ahead with talks to acquire a Brazilian alternative investment fund manager despite a potential clampdown on banks owning such operations.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase is pushing ahead with talks to acquire a Brazilian alternative investment fund manager despite a potential clampdown on banks owning such operations.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase is pushing ahead with talks to acquire a big Brazilian alternative investment fund manager, Gávea Investimentos, despite a potential clampdown on banks owning such operations, a person briefed on the matter told DealBook.

headline.main: JPMorgan Holds Talks to Acquire Brazilian Fund

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Michael J. de la Merced
